DOC.brief_summary: Cereal grains contain a wide variety of different phytochemicals which may play different roles in physiology. Their response in plasma and urine after a meal is poorly defined for most cereals. This study will investigate the plasma response and urinary excretion of cereal compounds after eating 6 different types of cereal preparation, with a focus on alkylresorcinols.
DOC.brief_title: Response of Alkylresorcinols to Different Cereals
DOC.detailed_description: This was a cross-over, randomized, double blind study with 6 arms (flours of different composition). Thirteen subjects completed the trial, where 100 g of each flour, mixed with 300 mL milk, was fed to all subjects.
DOC.criteria: Healthy Normaloverweight (BMI 1928 kg/m2) Nonsmokers Regular consumers of wholegrain cereals Allergy to cereal or milk products
